solution.text:
Volume of a cuboid = \(l \times b \times h\)
\(=_{{j*k}}_ \times _{{j*k*l}}_ \times _{{j*k}}_\)
\(=_{j}_ \times _{k}_ \times _{j}_ \times _{k}_ \times _{l}_ \times _{j}_ \times _{k}_\)
\(=_{j}_ \times _{j}_ \times _{j}_ \times _{k}_ \times _{k}_ \times _{k}_ \times _{l}_\)
Since the factor \(_{l}_\) appears only once on factorisation, we require \(_{l}_ \times _{l}_\) i.e. \(_{{l**2}}_\) such cuboids to make it a perfect cube.

content.text: Find the number of cuboids required of dimension \(_{{j*k}}_cm \times _{{j*k*l}}_cm \times _{{j*k}}_cm\) to form a perfect cube.
